# GitHub Copilot Instructions

Welcome to the ecom-service-patient-v2 project! This guide provides comprehensive instructions for GitHub Copilot to assist you effectively while maintaining our project standards and communication style.

## Quick Navigation

### Core Guidelines
- [Communication Style](./copilot-instructions/communication-style.md) - How to interact professionally and courteously
- [Code Generation & File Management](./copilot-instructions/code-generation.md) - Best practices for generating code and managing files
- [Agent Mode Behavior](./copilot-instructions/agent-mode.md) - Guidelines for working in autonomous agent mode

### Technical Standards
- [Java & Spring Boot Standards](./copilot-instructions/java-spring-boot.md) - Project-specific Java and Spring Boot conventions
- [Testing & Quality](./copilot-instructions/testing-quality.md) - Testing standards, code coverage, and quality requirements
- [API Development](./copilot-instructions/api-development.md) - RESTful API and OpenAPI/Swagger guidelines

## Project Overview

This is a Spring Boot microservice project that follows enterprise-grade development practices:
- **Language:** Java with Spring Boot framework
- **Code Coverage Target:** 90%
- **Quality Tools:** CheckStyle, Lombok, Jacoco
- **Deployment:** Kubernetes/Helm-based with multi-environment support
- **Security:** Azure Key Vault integration for secrets management

## Quick Reference

### ✅ Always Do
- Be polite, friendly, and professional in all communications
- Provide detailed explanations with context and reasoning
- Reference best practices and provide educational value
- Modify existing files directly when making changes
- Validate all changes for errors and potential issues
- Follow project conventions and coding standards

### ❌ Never Do
- Create summary files, changelog files, or fix documentation
- Generate README updates unless specifically asked
- Create temporary or scratch files for explanations
- Be terse or dismissive in responses
- Make assumptions without explaining your reasoning
- Skip error checking after making changes

---

For detailed information on each topic, please refer to the linked documents above.
